meanings.definition: To shout louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the game, Sarah outyelled her friend to cheer for their team.
meanings.sent2: The crowd outyelled each other in excitement at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully outyelled each other to see who could be the loudest.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter outyelled the noise of the busy street.
meanings.sent5: The thunder outyelled the sound of the rain as it roared through the sky.

meanings.definition: To have shouted louder than someone else.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, Tom outyelled his brother during their argument.
meanings.sent2: She outyelled her classmates to be heard over the noise in the cafeteria.
meanings.sent3: The cat outyelled the dog in a funny attempt to win the attention of their owner.
meanings.sent4: His excitement outyelled his fear as he rode the rollercoaster.
meanings.sent5: The alarm outyelled the music, waking up everyone in the house.
